context: The Estonian word 'lõppu' is the partitive case form of 'lõpp', which means 'end' or 'ending'. It indicates that something has reached its conclusion or final point. In these examples, it shows when work ends ('Töö on lõppeda'), when a game unexpectedly finished ('Mäng sai ootamatult lõpu'), and how quickly summer holidays came to an end ('Meie suvepühad läksid kiiresti lõppu').
